page.title: 08COMBE ESTATE 1 R MARKER
page.content: The Combe Estate is one of the oldest estates in Devon, and comprises tenanted farms and a substantial area of woodland together with most of the houses in the village of Gittisham and the oriinal family home, Combe House, which is now let out as a Hotel. The estate has been in the hands of one family since 1615, when it was acquired by Thomas Putt. It passed to the Marker family in 1846. Rihard Marker, the present owner, came over from Canada to take up his inheritance, but regards hmself only as a custodian of the Estate whose job is to keep it intact and thriving to pass on to future generations. The management of the Estate is carried out by Mr Marker and his professional advisors. The day-to-day running is carried out by the agents but regular meetings establish Estate policy.
